title: Highlights from Pakistan's Pashto-language TV, press, websites 26 Nov 19
snippet:
THE FOLLOWING IS A BBCM SELECTION OF MAJOR NEWS ITEMS PUBLISHED IN PAKISTAN'S PASHTO-LANGUAGE TV, PRESS AND ONLINE MEDIA OUTLETS ON 26 November 2019.

Wahdat
body:
India engaged in human rights violation in Kashmir: President

Pakistan's President Arif Alvi has said that the Indian government is engaged in human rights violation in Indian-administered Kashmir. He said the acts show the real face of India. He stated India has violated a number of international resolutions. He said the special status of Kashmir has been ended and the region is under curfew from 113 days. (front page, 180 words approx.)

PM Khan inaugurates Clean and Green Pakistan App

Prime Minister (PM) Imran Khan has inaugurated the Clean and Green Pakistan App at the convention centre in the federal capital Islamabad. The Green and Clean Pakistan project also includes Peshawar, Mardan, Bannu, Kohat and various other cities of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. (front page, 220 words approx.)

Chinese investors visits KP province

On the call of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Board of Investment and Trade, Chinese investors visited Peshawar for the first time. In an event in the Chief Minister House, around 40 investors and companies participated. CEO investment board Ahsan Daud said China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) Project would benefit both Pakistan and China. (front page, 200 words approx.)

[Wahdat gives good and equal coverage to both sides of the Durand Line (Pakistan-Afghan frontier), with a focus on Pashtun issues. The paper also publishes interviews with Afghan political leaders. It provides a balanced mix of anti-Taliban and pro-Taliban opinion.]

Khabroona

Taxed money to be invested in environmental projects: PM

PM Khan has said the environmental pollution is threatening human lives in the country. He stated that the whole nation should come forward to fight against environmental pollution. He said that people should pay taxes and the government would invest it on environment of the country. (front page, 220 words approx.)

Economy is moving towards stability: Finance Adviser to PM

Adviser to the Prime Minister of Pakistan on Finance & Revenue, Dr Abdul Shaikh, said economy of the country is moving towards stability and the investment in Pakistan's bonds has reached to one billion dollars. He said direct investment in the country has also increased in the country. He added with suitable environment, business and export would boom. (front page, 200 words approx.)

Court grants bail to father of human rights activist

Peshawar High Court has granted conditional bail to father of human rights activist Gulalai Ismail. Justice Qaisar Rashid heard the bail plea of Professor Ismail and ordered his release on bail. Professor Ismail was arrested last month after the hearing of cyber crime case in the Peshawar High Court. (back page, 140 words approx.)

[Khabroona is owned by the Peshawar-based Subh Group, which also publishes the Urdu daily Subh. It provides good coverage to both sides of the Durand Line (the Pakistan-Afghan frontier), with a focus on Pashtun issues. It provides a balanced mix of anti-Taliban and pro-Taliban opinion.]

Hewad

Government focused on improving infrastructure

Federal Minister for Planning, Asad Umar, has said that increasing export level and creating job opportunities is the policy of government. He added that to improve the infrastructure of the country there is need of investment. He said the government would work on the mode of transportation in the country and improve it further. (front page, 180 words approx.)

NAB directs to freeze businesses of PML-N leader's family

The National Accountability Bureau (Pakistan's top anti-corruption body) has ordered to freeze various industries of the former prime minister Nawaz Sharif's family in case of assets-beyond- means. The NAB has directed the concerned authorities to ensure fast implementation on the orders. The directions were issued to security and exchange commission of Pakistan, Nawaz Sharif's family and their financial adviser. (front page, 200 words approx.)

Won't compromise against government: PPP chairman

Pakistan People's Party (PPP) Chairman, Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, has said the government was free to do whatever they wanted, however PPP would not compromise and it would stand against the government. He said the currency has devalued up to great extent. He said all the cases level against the PPP were false. (front page,160 words approx.)

[Hewad is Pakistan's oldest Pashto newspaper, and gives equal coverage to both sides of the Durand Line (the Pakistan-Afghanistan frontier), with a focus on Pashtuns and religion.]

Tribal News Network

Expert team reaches Kurram district to investigate murder case

The team of experts reached Kurram district to investigate the murder of child after sexual abuse. District Police Officer Kurram Rahim Shah said the incident happened on 13 November and the police investigation is in process. He added that the expert team has investigated school staff and relatives of victim and it has started investigation in the case. (front page, 240 words approx.)

Three dead, four children injured in a firing incident

Three people including two children died and four other children were injured in a firing incident in a Kabbadi match. The incident occurred in Lakki Marwat of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. The incident occurred due to old dispute. According to Police, the opponent group opened fires on a Kabadi match, the dead bodies and injured were shifted to hospital. Police has started search for culprits after the incidents. (front page, 150 words approx.)

Two dead due to landmine explosion in KP province

Father and son killed were in bomb blast in Tank area of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. According to sources, Khan Gul and his son Wazir Shah were collecting wood in a forest near South Waziristan when a landmine exploded. Due to the explosion Wazir Shah died on spot, while Khan Gul was shifted to Combined Military Hospital in Dera Ismail Khan. Later, Gul died of his injuries. (front page, 260 words approx.)

[Tribal News Network (TNN) is a Peshawar-based online multimedia news agency. It provides news from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and the erstwhile tribal areas and focusses on their issues and problems. It was established in 2014 to serve radio audiences through partner FM radio stations and has now evolved into a news portal.]

Date Line (Prime Time Talk Show on AVT Khyber News at 17:00 gmt)

Discussion on ruling PTI foreign funding case

Anchor Hassan Khan said the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) was founded on a manifesto which ensured provision of Justice. He said there were allegations that the PTI received funds from foreign countries and have not cleared audit. He said after the Jamiat Ulema-i-Islam(Fazl) (JUI-F) sit-in movement, the speed of work on the funding cases has increased.

Former leader and founding member of the PTI Akbar S Babar said that he presented the case of illegal funding in front of Imran Khan in 2011, but he did not enquire into the matter. He said instead of accusations, the PTI and Imran Khan should confront facts. He stated that Prime Minister Imran Khan talks of morality and establishing Madina-like [Islamic shrine] state. Babar added instead of making things clear and providing details in the foreign funding case, Imran Khan was busy in blaming him. He said as a Chairman of the PTI, each year he [Imran Khan] provided an undertaking that his party was not involved in any illegal practice.

Legal Expert Tufail Shehzad said that if the foreign funding case was proved against the PTI, it would lead to the dissolution of the party and all the elected members of the PTI would be sent deposed from government.

He added that under such circumstances the members would not be able to contest election from the PTI in next term.

[AVT Khyber News is Pakistan's first Pashto-language satellite news channel and was launched in 2007. The Islamabad-based channel is owned by the AVT group, which first launched AVT Khyber (an entertainment channel) in 2004. AVT says it is "the voice of Pashtuns around the world". It has a network of reporters in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province and in Afghanistan.]

Mashriq Leads (Prime Time Talk Show on Mashriq TV at 14:00 gmt)

Women parliamentarian neglected in development funds

Anchor Salman Ali Shah said the opposition parties and government has agreed on the distribution of developmental funds in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. He added that women parliamentarians were ignored while distributing the funds. Member Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Assembly Rehana Ismail said that they were neglected in the funds distribution. She asked of equal treatment from the government in distribution of funds.

Journalist Shahid Hamid said women and minorities were ignored in the funds distribution. He added that opposition also assured women parliamentarian that if they don't receive funds, they would also boycott it.

Election for KP Senate seat

Anchor Shah said that the election for one seat of Senate [upper house of the parliament] will happen today [26 November] at Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Assembly.

The main contest for the seat was between Pakistan People's Party (PPP) and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) candidates.

Director News Mashriq TV Mehmood Jan said that there were bright chances that the PTI would win the senate seat from the KP assembly. He said that there was clear majority of the PTI in assembly and their party workers will not cast vote for the nother party.

Failure of farmers market in KP province

Anchor Shah said four farmer markets were established in Peshawar recently. He said these markets are now closed down and no one is there in the markets.

Journalist Syed Shabir Ali Shah said farmers markets failed to operate in the city and no one could be seen in the market. He said the rate of food item was relatively cheap during the inauguration ceremony but later farmers charged the same price.

[Mashriq TV is a Pashto-language channel launched in August 2016 and is a partner station of the BBC. It is owned by the Mashriq group of newspapers which also publishes English-language daily The Statement. The channel is observed to carry balanced reporting with no overt leanings towards any political party or group.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Pashto 1030 gmt 26 Nov 19
